channel.title: Hugo on Buring Ashes
channel.description: Recent content in Hugo on Buring Ashes

item.title: Getting Started with Hugo
item.description:
Intro

So here is the thing. Can we write something like

use std::collections::HashMap;
let mut hashmap: HashMap<i32, i32> = HashMap::new();
let closure = |x| hashmap.entry(x).or_insert(x+1);
println!("{:?}", closure(2));

in Rust?

The answer is, unfortunately, no.

more to come…
